page.title: 16St.Nicholas Parish Church.
page.content: This parish church in Chislehurst has been described as a 15th century church of rough flints and was partly rebuilt and restored after a fire in the bell chamber in 1857.Parts of the church are Saxon.The church is on the common and the school is nearby.in 1985 the vault under the Scadbury Chapel was opened. A search was being made for some document which were supposed to prove that Francis Bacon wrote Shakespeare's plays.Nothing was found. The church is still in use every Sunday and during the week.It has a peal of six bells which are still in use.Bell- ringing festivals are sometimes held there.
